requirements.summary: Make the homepage Hero cruise ship image fill the full viewport using a cover layout while keeping overlay text readable in light/dark mode.
acceptanceCriteria: On the homepage, the hero area uses the full viewport height (e.g., equivalent to Tailwind's h-screen/min-h-screen) instead of a fixed height.
The cruise ship image (/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg) visually covers the full hero area (no empty side space), cropping as needed rather than letterboxing.
Hero text/CTAs remain visible on top of the full-screen image and are still readable in both light and dark modes.
No changes are required in the backend; this is a styling/layout-only update.

file_operations.description: Update the Hero layout to use full viewport sizing (replace the fixed h-[600px] with h-screen/min-h-screen and ensure full-width behavior), and change the cruise ship positioning/sizing from h-full w-auto to a true cover-style layout (e.g., absolute inset-0 with w-full h-full object-cover) so /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg covers the entire hero area without side gaps. Ensure overlays/gradients keep the text and CTAs readable in both light and dark modes.
